channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for VA
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for VA

item.title: Report X-2025041915
item.description:
Report X-2025041915

Identified by scraper @ 2025-05-23T00:57:51+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-04-17
  • City: LYNCHBURG
  • State: VA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: The shipment was discovered leaking during sort operations. Outer packaging: UN4GV/X40.1/S/25 USA/M586. Inner contents: 3 glass bottles @ 4 Liters each, wrapped in bubble wrap and vermiculite. One bottle was broken. All contents were placed in a salvage drum and held for shipper disposition.

item.title: Report E-2025040394
item.description:
Report E-2025040394

Identified by scraper @ 2025-05-18T21:15:32+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-04-15
  • City: COLONIAL HEIGHTS
  • State: VA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On April 15, 2025, one (1) 6-gallon pail of UN1993 was punctured and released approximately five (5) gallons of product to the trailer interior and pavement beneath. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from EnviroServe (ES) to remediate the site. The crew utilized absorbents and hand tools to remediate the site. The damaged pail and impacted materials were containerized in two (2) 55-gallon drums.
